label: 竺仙
本: Jewel in the Ashes: Buddha Relics and Power in Early Medieval Japan . Harvard University Asia Center . 2000
説明文: Chu-hsien (Ch.) 竺仙, originally called 梵僊 Fan-hsien (J. Bonsen). Chinese monk of the Lin-chi Ch'an (J. Rinzai Zen) who arrived in Japan in 1329, and was patronized by Ashikaga Tadayoshi and other powerful figures of the shogunate. He resided in Jōmyōji, Jōchiji, Nanzenji, and Kenchōji before founding Muryōjiji near the end of his life.
